meanings.definition: A particular mode in which something exists or is experienced.
meanings.sent1: The different modalities of learning include visual, auditory, and kinesthetic methods.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use various modalities such as surgery, medication, and therapy to treat patients.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the modalities of communication evolve from letters to instant messaging.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork showcased a unique modality of expression, blending colors and textures in unconventional ways.
meanings.sent5: The modalities of nature in the forest were breathtaking, from the rustling leaves to the chirping birds.

meanings.definition: A method or procedure for accomplishing something.
meanings.sent1: The modality of baking a cake involves mixing ingredients, baking, and decorating.
meanings.sent2: Learning different modalities of studying can help students find what works best for them.
meanings.sent3: He tried a new modality of organizing his schedule, but it ended up causing more confusion.
meanings.sent4: The modality of problem-solving is like navigating a maze, finding the right path to the solution.
meanings.sent5: The modality of building a house requires careful planning, skilled labor, and quality materials.
